extension.name: Dump DB
extension.description: Dump your database into a single SQL-file

releases.release: Search Index compatibility. Due to the potentially huge size in search index indexes their data isn't being saved. Dumps will contain only their structure but not their content. Note that after importing a dump all your indexes will be gone so you'll have to re-index them.

Symphony 2.2 compatibility. Removed hash and date from filename. Hash isn't needed as `.sql` files are now protected by `.htaccess` and date can be injected in the filename without the need for sprintf.

Extension will now show a notification on every backend page if one of the dump files is newer than your database. Also, it will show a notification and disable the "Dump"-buttons if one of the files isn't writeable.
Extension will now dump and restore both data and authors into two seperate files.
New function to restore database from dump. Be advised that this feature may not work in some cases. To enable this feature you need to activate it manually in your config file.
Dump-file will now have a random hash in its filename for security reasons.
Dump is now being saved into /workspace/dump.sql instead of offered for download.
Prevented dumping data of `cache` and `sessions` tables.
Initial release. Mainly a copy of Alistairs Export Ensemble.
